jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
The Growth Manager will work closely with product analysts, engineering, marketing, research, and design to strategize, plan, and execute programs focused on improving acquisition, activation, retention, and loyalty for our product. The ideal candidate is equal parts growth marketer, analyst, and business strategist! They start from the customer experience and delve into writing CRM briefs and experiment designs that encourage our users to experience the product’s core value as quickly as possible. We're looking for someone who gets out of bed every day thinking about new ways to grow the business, and who works in exponents vs. increments.
 
Ideal candidates are process-oriented, results-driven, and problem-solving self-starters. They have experience with loyalty incentives and have strategic ideas on driving consumer experience via user psychology, UI/UX changes, gamification, and content marketing. This role will provide an opportunity to greatly impact the homepage of Gojek and how we personalize user experiences globally.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• Discover growth opportunities by proactively exploring the product’s funnel conversion rates for different segments of users
  • Manage and prioritize experiment ideas based on Impact, Confidence, and Effort (ICE) scores
  • Work with analysts to implement and analyze A/B or Multivariate Tests that provide in-depth insights into the product team and an understanding of what core value for product is
  • Maintain timelines to iterate and build new features based on experiment results
  • Performing retroactive analysis of new features to evaluate their impact on Gojek's North Star Metrics
  • Proactively review the experiment process in the team and act on how to drive faster experimentation process
  • Present findings to senior management to drive business and strategic decision-making on feature prioritization and impact analysis

• BS/MS in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or equivalent experience. Strong knowledge of SQL
  • Minimum 5 years of working experience with 1-year leadership experience
  • Strong team player and business acumen; possessing team synergy skills with a high level of enthusiasm in collaborating, influencing and leading cross-functional teams.
  • Strong project management skills to manage complex projects, and familiar with the tools (e.g. Trello, Favro, Jira). A creative design-thinking, problem-solving mindset and ability to manage and prioritize multiple internal and external stakeholders
  • Proficiency with multiple analytic and database tools common within a marketing organization (e.g., MixPanel, Tableau, etc)
